description:
Hy,

I'm installing OpenStack grizzly on Debian Wheezy. Packages are fetched from gplhost. There is a dependency problem with nova-novncproxy, its version is 2013.1-2 (nova-novncproxy_2013.1-2_all.deb), all other nova packages have version 2013.1.2-1~bpo70+1.
Is there a solution for this problem?

Regards
title: Debian Wheezy nova-novncproxy nova-common dependency conflict

comments.content:
Hy,

I'm installing OpenStack grizzly on Debian Wheezy. Packages are fetched from gplhost. There is a dependency problem with nova-novncproxy, its version is 2013.1-2 (nova-novncproxy_2013.1-2_all.deb), all other nova packages have version 2013.1.2-1~bpo70+1.
Is there a solution for this problem?

Regards
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vladimir-nikolic-o

comments.content:
Hi vladimirnikolic,

You can download http://archive.gplhost.com/debian/pool/grizzly/main/n/nova/nova-novncproxy_2013.1-2_all.deb

dpkg --force-depends-version -i nova-novncproxy_2013.1-2_all.deb

it seems work for me..

by the way, This is not a debian issue. All packages are belong grizzly repo.. Maybe, reported it to grizzly maintainer.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kansukose-p
